Key Arguments: The bill represents government overreach and threatens democratic freedoms.
It is impossible for any single entity to accurately determine what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The bill could lead to excessive censorship by social media platforms due to fear of fines.
Truth is often not settled and requires ongoing debate and discovery.
The bill could stifle scientific discovery and investigative journalism.
Government bodies and sanctioned organizations being exempt from scrutiny is unfair.
The bill could lead to increased digital surveillance and invasion of privacy.
The bill is a power grab by the government to control information.
Notable Quotes: It is impossible to claim you can know what it truth and what is misinformation without serious time, debate, study and discussion.
Truth is often not SETTLED, we are always in a state of learning and discovery.
This bill reveals your true intent to DOMINATE AND EXERT CONTROL OVER THE PEOPLE.
This Bill is effectively giving government power to be sole arbiter of truth, that will only allow what it decides is truth, to be said.
